column4: Hello, I'm on ubuntu 8.10 and my soundsystem is 'hijacked', meaning no program produces sounds atm - Vlc crashed. How do I regain the sound without rebooting?
iykrichie sorry, the /etc/init.d/alsa-utils restart needed to be run as sudo
None of them worked. The second one restarted the mixer applet in gnome aswell.
maybe it's something wrong with the sound configuration then. IDd you change anything recently?
I haven't changed anything since last boot.
sorry, I'm out of my experience now. All I can suggest is searching the forums.
ok, well thanks for the help. I'l try rebooting the whole machine.
ouch ... I hope it still fails (because otherwise, it could be something difficult to find)
if it fails after a restart then maybe an update broke a configuration somewhere or something, but that's all I can think of.
